{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3255378,"name":"Daniel","username":"daniel.y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-11-18T21:55:51.896Z","cooked":"

I understand that in actual competitions this would not be allowed, however I would like to use it with some of my unused wireless controllers at home.

Is there software that is necessary to connect these controllers for the driverstation to be able to recognize it? If not, what are some ways to utilize them?

Thank you very much for your time

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-11-18T21:55:51.896Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":103.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":444542,"topic_slug":"how-to-connect-a-controller-w-o-usb-for-use-in-driverstation","display_username":"Daniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60279,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-connect-a-controller-w-o-usb-for-use-in-driverstation/444542/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3255382,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-18T22:11:11.608Z","cooked":"

If it’s a Bluetooth or regular PC recognized joystick it will work. Drive station looks for PID joystick type devices. Example an Xbox One with the wireless adapter would work, PS4 with Bluetooth may work (depends how your PC recognizes it).

If all else fails…

What you are looking for is software that will act like a USB controller from any input source.

On a computer there is a standard driver for treating devices as a PID compliant input device like a mouse, keyboard or joystick. Like in this guide here for an Arduino Leonardo

Instructables

Create a Joystick Using the Arduino Joystick Library 2.0

Create a Joystick Using the Arduino Joystick Library 2.0: Since I released the original Arduino Joystick Library (see https://www.instructables.com/id/Arduino-LeonardoMicro-as-Game-ControllerJoystick/ for more details) I have received numerous...

If you had a way to connect your wireless controllers at home to the Arduino that would work as a passthrough device.

In either scenario the drive station just knows there is a joystick connected to the computer, not how it’s connected.
